General.preQuizText: Now that you have learned all about linings, let's do a quick review and see how much you remember!
General.postQuizText: Well done! Feel free to repeat the quiz as often as you'd like.

Questions.questionText: Linings are almost always used by decorators for custom window treatments.

answers.feedBack: Correct! Linings provide the client with a quality and long lasting treatment. There are many benefits to using linings on all window treatments.
Incorrect! Linings provide the client with a quality and long lasting treatment. There are many benefits to using linings on all window treatments.

Questions.questionText: Which of the following are benefits of using linings on a window treatment? Select all that apply

answers.answerText: Provides insulation in summer and winter
answers.feedBack: Correct! While adding a lining allows a fabric pattern to be seen better without the sun shining through, it does not make the colours look more vibrant.

answers.answerText: Protects the fabric from sun damage
answers.feedBack: Correct! While adding a lining allows a fabric pattern to be seen better without the sun shining through, it does not make the colours look more vibrant.

answers.answerText: Makes the fabric colours appear more vibrant
answers.feedBack: Incorrect. While adding a lining allows a fabric pattern to be seen better without the sun shining through, it does not make the colours look more vibrant.

answers.answerText: Helps reduce noise from the outdoors

Questions.questionText: Your client has just moved into a 150 year old stone house and would like you to decorate the main floor, starting with window treatments. Which lining would work best for this type of home?

answers.feedBack: Incorrect! Old homes tend to be drafty and don't have the same R-value insulation that new homes have. Thermal linings would help retain the heat in the cold months and keep it cooler in the warm months.
